alert.note: Alert for Boyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Boyd, southeastern Lawrence, central Cabell, northwestern Lincoln and northern Wayne Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ceredo, or near Huntington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Wayne, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Beech Fork State Park, Barboursville, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Ona, Burnaugh, Centerville, South Point, Burlington, West Hamlin, Lockwood, Lavalette, Salt Rock and Pea Ridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky near mile marker 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
